turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Fast food advertising.
turn.1: What is the impact of fast food advertising?
turn.2: The effect of these campaigns is often denied by the fast food companies and the television networks that carry their advertisements.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Some networks have also claimed that tighter regulations would reduce advertising income and that would reduce the quality of children's programming.
turn.5: What did you find interesting about this article?
turn.6: In Sweden, all advertising aimed at the under-12s is banned, including fast food adverts.
turn.7: Is there anything else that is interesting?
turn.8: Faced with restricted television, radio and print regulation, many fast food companies have started making use of Internet advertising to reach their customers.
turn.10: On June 3, 2004 KFC withdrew American television commercials claiming that "fried chicken can, in fact, be part of a healthy diet" after reaching a settlement with the Federal Trade Commission.
turn.12: Advertising authorities regularly receive complaints about fast food advertisements, with members of the public usually claiming that the wording is misleading.
